title: Fort Pulaski National Monument: Animals
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Animals               Animals         Great Blue Heron surveys the moat. FOPU  The salt marshes and upland areas of Fort Pulaski National Monument support many species of wildlife. If lucky you may catch a glimpse of one of the 11 Protected Species that have been identified at the park. These are: American oystercatcher, bald eagle, gull-billed tern, least tern, loggerhead sea turtle, manatee, peregrine falcon, piping plover, swallow-tailed kite, Wilson's plover and woodstork.  Click on the links at left to learn more about the varied wildlife that call Fort Pulaski National Monument home.  Â     White-tailed deer found throughout Cockspur Island. FOPU
